body.p: This Army was created on April 2, 1864. It consisted of the Tenth Corps and Eighteenth Corps. The Army was reorganized on June 18, 1864, each corps having three divisions. On December 3, 1864, the Secreatary of War—upon request from Grant and Butler—ordered the reorganization the Army of the James into two new corps, the newly created Twenty-fourth Corps composed of the all white old Tenth and Eighteenth Crops and the newly create Twenty-fifth Corps composed of the African American troops of the Departments of Virginia and North Carolina. By August 1, 1865, the Army of the James had been disbanded and reassigned. Commander(s): William F. Smith, Benjamin F. Butler, Edward O. C. Ord, David B. Birney, Benjamin F. Butler, Godfrey Weitzel, and Alfred H. Terry.
